problem.description: Current folder system uses global shared folders that don't scale well for multiple projects. Files are organized either by project OR by folder, leading to poor organization and mixed content. Asset documentation is scattered across generic folders with no direct asset association.

current-limitations.limitation: Global folder names must be unique across all projects
Folder lists become unwieldy with many projects
No project isolation - files from different projects mixed together
Asset documentation not directly linked to specific assets

business-value.benefit: Better organization and scalability for multi-project environments
Industry-standard project isolation and security model
Direct asset-to-documentation traceability for maintenance and compliance
Flexible folder structures customized per project type
Easier project archiving and lifecycle management

industry-standards.standard: Microsoft SharePoint: Project sites with isolated folder structures

solution.overview: Implement a three-level documentation hierarchy: 1. Project Level: High-level project documentation in project-scoped folders 2. Asset Level: Equipment-specific documentation directly linked to assets 3. File Categorization: Structured file types (manuals, specs, photos, etc.)
